p: Alginic acid was first discovered and isolated by Dr. E.C.C. Stanford in 1881 [ 35]. Alginates (i.e., sodium alginate (E401), potassium alginate (E402), ammonium alginate (E403), and calcium alginate (E404)) are monovalent salts of alginic acid (E400) [ 27, 41, 42]. Alginic acid and calcium alginate are insoluble in water while sodium alginate, potassium alginate, and ammonium alginate are water-soluble polymers [ 42, 43]. They have a limited solubility at low pH values [ 44]. The solubility of different types of alginates in numerous solvents and solutions were listed by Kimica Corporation [ 45].
